Carn nan Gabhar

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Carn nan Gabhar is the highest and remotest summit of Beinn a' Ghlo. It offers views across the empty wilderness of the Mounth and makes a fine termination to a grand ridge-walk.

 You have not climbed Carn nan Gabhar.

Region: Perthshire

Altitude: 1121 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.91/5
Rating: 3.9/5 (93 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn a' Ghlo from Loch Moraig

Other routes and challenges

Carn nan Gabhar is almost invariably climbed as part of the classic traverse of Beinn a' Ghlo from Loch Moraig.

It is, however, possible to climb both Carn nan Gabhar and Braigh Coire Chruinn-bhalgain from beautiful Glen Tilt to the north, through the approach would be an extremely long one. A bridge over the Tilt at NN956761 would likely by of use.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Perthshire Hotels

Perthshire B&B

Perthshire Cottages

Perthshire Hostels
